content: 6-10 row using yarns from one of the other color families slowly striping yarns like noro and crystal palace mochi yarns allow simple transitions between colors alternate sections of your base color and sections of your complementary colors being sure to work your base color in gather these 4 tails together create a loop and pull the end the last row before binding off through forming an overhand knot never work more than two row of the same exact yarn in a row the vertical stripes will overwhelm the overall mix of color be sure to alternate different weights of yarns so the differences in gauge are varied across the row snippet ©2015 becky herrick - all rights reserved for personal use only - version 07092015 2 pattern by becky herrick every effort was made to provide an error free pattern however mistakes do happen please e-mail becky herrick@gmail com with any questions concerns and/or errata thank you for downloading this pattern and supporting my designs this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only feel free to knit this pattern for yourself for gifts to others and for charity if you wish to sell items made from this pattern please contact me for details becky herrick lives on the western slopes of the green mountains when she s not designing she spins gardens hikes snowshoes skis goes canoeing and watches the chickens oh yeah and she has a day job too you can find out what she s up to right now on her blog ramblings snippet ©2015 becky herrick - all rights reserved for personal use only - version 07092015 3
